DataElement.preferredName: Sphincter Surgery Surgery Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator to determine if a tumor meets criteria for sphincter-sparing surgical resection

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A ring-shaped muscle that relaxes or tightens to open or close a passage or opening in the body. Examples are the anal sphincter (around the opening of the anus) and the pyloric sphincter (at the lower opening of the stomach)._A procedure to remove or repair a part of the body or to find out whether disease is present.  An operation._A procedure to remove or repair a part of the body or to find out whether disease is present.  An operation.

Concepts.definition: A circular band of muscle that functions to regulate the size of an orifice in the body.
A procedure to remove or repair a part of the body or to find out whether disease is present.  An operation.
